alert.note: Alert for Crockett; Irion (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 17 at 7:25PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Crockett and extreme southwestern Irion Counties through 815 PM CDT... At 724 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 13 miles north of The Intersection Of I-10 And Highway 290, or 18 miles east of Iraan, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. This storm also has frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Barnhart and The Intersection Of Us 190 And Highway 163. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for west central Texas.
